Article Title: Over 100 Google DeepMind employees write open letter, want Google to stop working on these contracts
Article Text: Over 100 Google DeepMind employees write open letter , want Google to stop working on these contractsAbout 200 employees at Google DeepMind, the company’s AI division's, have signed an open letter urging the company to end its contracts with military organisations , Time Magazine reports. The letter, dated May 16, 2024, expresses concerns that DeepMind's AI technology is being used for warfare purposes, potentially violating Google's own AI principles.The letter specifically references Google's defence contract with the Israeli military, known as Project Nimbus , as well as reports of AI being used for mass surveillance and target selection in Gaza. While not focusing on any particular conflict, the signatories emphasise that their concerns are about upholding ethical AI practices ."Any involvement with military and weapon manufacturing impacts our position as leaders in ethical and responsible AI, and goes against our mission statement and stated AI Principles," the letter states, according to Time.When Google acquired DeepMind in 2014, it promised that the lab's technology would never be used for military or surveillance purposes. DeepMind’s AI principles prohibit working on applications that cause “overall harm” or aid in building weapons or technology intended to cause injury. However, as DeepMind has been integrated more closely with Google's core operations, this separation has become less distinct.The letter calls on DeepMind's leadership to investigate claims of military use of Google Cloud services, terminate military access to DeepMind technology, and establish a new governance body to prevent future military applications.As of August 2024, Google has not substantially responded to the employees' concerns, Time reports. "We have received no meaningful response from leadership," one employee told the magazine, "and we are growing increasingly frustrated."A Google spokesperson defended the company's practices, stating, "When developing AI technologies and making them available to customers, we comply with our AI Principles, which outline our commitment to developing technology responsibly."This internal dissent follows a previous protests against Project Nimbus, which resulted in Google firing dozens of employees earlier this year.
Article Summary: About 200 employees at Google DeepMind, the company’s AI division's, have signed an open letter urging the company to end its contracts with military organisations. The letter, dated May 16, 2024, expresses concerns that DeepMind's AI technology is being used for warfare purposes, potentially violating Google's own AI principles.

Article Title: Government warn users of fake ‘cold dink’ WhatsApp message: Here’s what it is
Article Text:
What is the message

Tips to stay safe from fake WhatsApp messages

Verify the sender: Always check the sender's profile and contact details to ensure they are genuine.



Beware of suspicious links: Avoid clicking on links in messages from unknown senders or those that seem too good to be true.



Don't share personal information: Never share your personal details, such as your bank account number, credit card information, or passwords, with anyone over WhatsApp unless you are absolutely sure of their identity.



Be cautious of urgent requests: Scammers often create a sense of urgency to trick you into acting quickly.



Report suspicious messages: If you receive a message that you believe is suspicious, report it to WhatsApp or the appropriate authorities.



Keep your WhatsApp updated: Ensure your WhatsApp app is always up-to-date with the latest security patches.

Government has issued a warning against a fake message circulating on WhatsApp . Claiming to be from the Government of India, the message asks users not to avoid cold drinks as they are contaminated with Eobla virus. However, PIB Fact Check has confirmed that it is a fake message.PIB Fact Check unit which helps in dispelling myths, rumours and false claims posted on X (formerly known as Twitter) has confirmed that it is a fake messages and has asked users not to believe this fake information.“Did you also receive a #WhatsApp forward claiming that the Government of India has advised citizens to avoid cold drinks as they are contaminated with the Ebola virus #PIBFactCheck Beware! This message is #fake @MoHFW_INDIA has issued no such advisory!,” reads the post.Please forward this information Hyderabad Police all over India. Please do not drink soft drinks like Maja, Coco Cola, 7up, thumps, Pepsi, sprite etc… because one of the company’s workers mixed the contaminated blood of the dangerous virus called Ebola in it. This news was reported on NDTV channel yesterday. Please help by forwarding this message to everyone. Thanks.”
Article Summary: Government has issued a warning against a fake message circulating on WhatsApp. Claiming to be from the Government of India, the message asks users not to avoid cold drinks as they are contaminated with Eobla virus. PIB Fact Check unit which helps in dispelling myths, rumours and false claims has confirmed that it is a fake messages.

Article Title: Elon Musk may be ready to offer X employees stock options, but on one condition
Article Text: Elon Musk revealed that X employees will receive stock options based on their contributions, requiring a one-page summary of their work. This move follows delays in promotions and anxiety over layoffs.
Article Summary: X employees will receive stock options based on their contributions, requiring a one-page summary of their work. This move follows delays in promotions and anxiety over layoffs. Elon Musk revealed that X employees will be given stock options on the basis of their contributions.

Article Title: Cognizant sues Infosys in the US court: Here's what the complaint says
Article Text:
What Cognizant's lawsuit against Infosys claims

US-based software major Cognizant TriZetto has filed a lawsuit against Indian tech giant Infosys in a Texas federal court. The lawsuit filed by Cognizant alleges that Infosys has stolen trade secrets related to its healthcare insurance software. New Jersey-based Cognizant has 70% employees based out of India.Infosys has vehemently denied these allegations and has vowed to defend itself in court.“Infosys is aware of the lawsuit. We deny all allegations and will defend our position in the court,” an Infosys spokesperson said.Cognizant claims that Infosys unlawfully extracted data from its databases and used this information to develop and market competing software. According to the Cognizant's complaint, Infosys misused TriZetto's software to create "Test Cases for Facets," which improperly repackaged TriZetto's data into an Infosys product. Additionally, in the complaint, Cognizant also said that Infosys broke the law by creating software to extract data from QNXT that includes confidential TriZetto information and trade secrets.Cognizant's software includes TriZetto's Facets and QNXT, used by healthcare insurance companies to automate administrative tasks.Cognizant is seeking unspecified monetary damages and an injunction to prevent Infosys from continuing to misuse its trade secrets. This lawsuit comes on the heels of a similar dispute with Atos' Syntel in 2020, where Cognizant initially won $854 million but later saw the award reduced and ultimately overturned on appeal.The case is Cognizant TriZetto Software Group Inc vs Infosys Ltd, in the US District Court for the Northern District of Texas.
Article Summary: Cognizant TriZetto has filed a lawsuit against Indian tech giant Infosys in a Texas federal court. The lawsuit alleges that InfosYS has stolen trade secrets related to Cognizant's healthcare insurance software. The software company is seeking unspecified monetary damages and an injunction to prevent Infasys from continuing to misuse its trade secrets.

Article Title: This malware poses as GTA IV and Adobe tool to steal data from MacBooks
Article Text:
What researchers said about the malware



Security researchers have uncovered a new malware threat targeting macOS users . Dubbed " Cthulhu Stealer ," the malware impersonates popular apps to steal sensitive information such as system passwords , iCloud Keychain credentials, and cryptocurrency wallet data.According to a report by The Hacker News, this new malware has been available to attackers since 2023 as a $500/month paid service.The report also claims that the Cthulhu Stealer can be effective as it can disguise itself as legitimate software very well.As per the report, the Cthulhu Stealer malware targets macOS users by posing as legitimate software programs such as CleanMyMac, Grand Theft Auto IV, and Adobe GenP tool that hat patches Adobe apps to bypass the Creative Cloud service and activates them without a serial key.Once executed, the malware prompts users to enter their system password, iCloud Keychain passwords, and MetaMask credentials.Cthulhu Stealer also harvests system information and web browser cookies before exfiltrating the stolen data to a remote server. The malware's ability to bypass security measures and its data-stealing capabilities make it a significant threat to macOS users.While the threat actors behind Cthulhu Stealer may no longer be active, still the malware itself poses a significant risk to macOS users, the report adds. Due to the relative security of macOS compared to Windows and Linux, users may be more likely to bypass Gatekeeper protections, making them vulnerable to such threats.To protect against Cthulhu Stealer and other malware, users should prioritise downloading apps from known sources like the Mac App Store or official developer websites. Avoiding unsigned files and exercising caution when prompted to enter sensitive information can also help mitigate the risk of infection.So, before bypassing macOS Gatekeeper to open a downloaded app, users should ensure that it's coming from a trustworthy source.
Article Summary: Malware known as Cthulhu Stealer impersonates popular apps to steal sensitive information. Malware has been available to attackers since 2023 as a $500/month paid service. Users should prioritise downloading apps from known sources like the Mac App Store or official developer websites.

Article Title: Microsoft, CrowdStrike to meet next month over Windows security changes: What they will discuss
Article Text:
Here’s what the companies will discuss

Microsoft has announced that it is hosting a summit next month where it will invite companies and partners, including CrowdStrike , that provide endpoint security technologies . The announcement comes about a month after what may be considered the largest IT outage in history triggered by a faulty software update from security vendor CrowdStrike.“On Sept.10, 2024, Microsoft will host a Windows Endpoint Security Ecosystem Summit at our Redmond, Washington, headquarters. Microsoft, CrowdStrike and key partners who deliver endpoint security technologies will come together for discussions about improving resiliency and protecting mutual customers’ critical infrastructure,” the company said.As per Microsoft, its “objective is to discuss concrete steps we will all take to improve security and resiliency for our joint customers.”A botched update affected 8.5 million Windows systems around the world, with insurers reportedly estimating the outage cost to US Fortune 500 companies to be $5.4 billion.“The CrowdStrike outage in July 2024 presents important lessons for us to apply as an ecosystem. Our discussions will focus on improving security and safe deployment practices, designing systems for resiliency and working together as a thriving community of partners to best serve customers now, and in the future,” Microsoft said.Microsoft also plans to include government representatives in the Windows Endpoint Security Ecosystem Summit alongside its ecosystem partners. This move aims to create transparency in the community's collaborative efforts to develop more secure and reliable technology.“It is expected that the Windows Endpoint Security Ecosystem Summit will lead to next steps in both short- and long-term actions and initiatives to pursue, with improved security and resilience as our collective goal. We will share further updates on these conversations following the event,” the company said.
Article Summary: Microsoft will host a Windows Endpoint Security Ecosystem Summit next month. Summit will invite companies and partners that provide endpoint security technologies. Announcement comes about a month after what may be considered the largest IT outage in history triggered by a faulty software update from CrowdStrike.

Article Title: Ola relaunches this service 4 years after its suspension: What CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said
Article Text:
Ola Coins loyalty program introduced



Ola has officially relaunched its car-pooling service, Ola Share . Starting with Bangalore, this service will allow Ola Cabs users to share their rides which were suspended due to the Covid-19 pandemic. In 2020, Ola paused this service to curb the spread of coronavirus. At the company’s recent ‘Sankalp’ community event, CEO Bhavish Aggarwal announced the return of the feature.Watch the event here (cue 3:11:50):“We are bringing back Ola Share with cheaper and lower-cost rides. This time with a much better AI-driven algorithm,” Aggarwal said at the Sankalp community event.The service has already gone live in Bangalore. Aggarwal confirmed that the service will “expand to other cities soon.”Apart from announcing the return of Ola Share, Aggarwal introduced a loyalty program named Ola Coins that will offer customers benefits for using the company’s services.“A loyalty program across all Ola services. You’ll be able to earn and redeem these coins with every transaction. You’ll have personalised loyalty benefits,” Aggarwal added.This service has also gone live only in Bangalore. Aggarwal said that this loyalty program will be scaled up across other cities “very soon.”Earlier this month, Ola Electric Mobility, became India’s first electric vehicle manufacturer , to get listed on the stock exchange.Ola raised over Rs 5,500 crore through the IPO, with plans to allocate a significant portion of the funds towards various initiatives. The company said that it will invest Rs 1,600 crore in research and product development, repay debts with Rs 800 crore, and allocate Rs 350 crore for organic growth.Furthermore, Ola intends to utilise Rs 1,227.6 crore to expand the capacity of its cell manufacturing plant from 5 GWh to 6.4 GWh.
Article Summary: Ola has officially relaunched its car-pooling service, Ola Share. Starting with Bangalore, this service will allow Ola Cabs users to share their rides. This service was suspended due to the Covid-19 pandemic. Ola also introduced a loyalty program named Ola Coins.

Article Title: Google launches Pixel 9 Pro Fold, it’s first-ever foldable phone in India
Article Text:
Pixel 9 Pro Fold has bigger and brighter displays

Tensor G4, Gemini and more AI inside

Upgraded cameras with the new 'Add me' AI feature for photos

Google has launched its second-generation Pixel foldable phone, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold , which is its first-ever foldable phone in India. The second-gen Pixel Fold upgrades on some salient aspects over the first one. Per Google, the foldable is slim, super durable, and has a brighter screen, both on the outside and inside. And, the phone also packs in Pixel’s “fastest, most powerful” Tensor G4 chip , bringing on-device multimodal capabilities to the phone.On the inside, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold comes equipped with an 8 inches ‘Super Actua Flex display,’ an LTPO panel with a 2922x1344 resolution at 486 PPI. The inner screen has a dynamic refresh rate of 1-120Hz and can go as bright as 3,000 nits, which Google says is 80% brighter than the screen on the first-gen Pixel Fold. To make use of phone’s large inner canvas, there’s a split-screen mode that’ll let you use two apps side-by-side.When unfolded, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold can be used a regular phone with a 6.3 inches outer screen, which has the same specs as the inner screen.Google says that the Pixel 9 Pro Fold has an “all-new” hinge that is made from stainless steel and has an aerospace grade aluminium alloy cover. The hinge has a polished finish, while the back has the silky matt finish. The phone is rated IPX8 for water resistivity. And there’s Gorilla Glass Victus 2 on the outside.Powering the Pixel 9 Pro Fold is Google’s Tensor G4 chip, also found on the other three Pixel 9 phones. The chip comes paired with 16GB of RAM and up to 1TB storage. Then, there’s theTitan M2 security coprocessor , which enables multi-layer hardware security.There’s a 5,060mAh battery, which Google promises will last for over 24 hours and up to 100 hours with Extreme Battery Saver. The phone supports fast charging at 45W, which should fill up the battery up to 55% in about 30 minutes. FYI, the charger isn’t included in the box. The phone also supports Qi wireless charging and Battery Share, i.e., reverse wireless charging.Out-of-the-box the Pixel 9 Pro Fold will come with Android 14 . There’s the usual Google promise of 7 years of OS and security updates.Would it even be a Pixel phone, if there’s no AI in it. Well, there’s a whole lot of AI. For starters Gemini is there, and it works in split-screen mode, as well. One could ask Gemini to write stuff or even get info about whats’s on the screen or photos. Circle To Search is also there, ohh and this feature can help you check if an image has been created using AI.The new “Pixel-exclusive” AI feature to arrive is Pixel Screenshots. The feature could organise or recall things, like events and location, all you need to is ask the phone.Google is giving one year of the Google One AI Premium plan for free to those who’ll buy the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. So, that’ll give you access to Gemini Advanced, Gemini in Gmail and Docs, on top of 2TB of cloud storage.The Pixel 9 Pro Fold ditches the camera visor for a squircle module that houses a triple lens setup – a 50MP wide camera, a 48MP ultraide and a 48MP 5x telephoto camera. For selfies, there's a 42 MP front-facing camera on the inner screen and 10MP camera on the outside.The camera hardware has been only a part of Pixel’s camera, but it’s AI that completes it. There’s a long list of AI features that complements the camera hardware on the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. The usual Super Res Zoom, Zoom Enhance, Video Boost, Face Unblur, Photo Unblur, Best Take, Magic Eraser, Audio Eraser, and Magic Editor makes their return. Well, Magic Eraser now has an a “reimagine” feature that Google says can give photos a “whole new look.”One new AI tool to come to Google’s Pixel 9 pro Fold is the “Add Me,” which as you’d image can add you to a picture. So, how does it work? Well, you take photo with the group, swap in yourself, and AI will merge the photos.Google Pixel 9 Pro Fold is priced in India at Rs 1,72,999 and will be available for purchase later this year. While it comes in two colours – Obsidian and Porcelain – it’ll be available only in Obsidian colour in India.
Article Summary: Google has launched its second-generation Pixel foldable phone, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. The second-gen Pixel Fold upgrades on some salient aspects over the first one. Per Google, the foldable is slim, super durable, and has a brighter screen, both on the outside and inside. And, the phone also packs in Pixel’s “fastest, most powerful” Tensor G4 chip.

Article Title: General Motors lays off over 1,000 employees, including hundreds of software engineers; says “grateful to …
Article Text:
Job cuts come after the change of leadership

GM recently faced a few software incidents

General Motors is laying off more than 1,000 salaried employees globally in its software and services division, the company confirmed earlier this week. The job cuts , which include about 600 positions at GM's tech campus near Detroit, come as part of a review to streamline operations in the unit."As we build GM's future, we must simplify for speed and excellence, make bold choices, and prioritise the investments that will have the greatest impact," GM said in a statement to CNBC.The layoffs represent approximately 1.3% of GM's global salaried workforce of 76,000 as of the end of 2023. The cuts primarily affect the automaker's US operations. Impacted employees were notified Monday morning."We are grateful to those who helped establish a strong foundation that positions GM to lead moving forward," the automaker added in its statement."As a result, we're reducing certain teams within the Software and Services organisation," GM stated. The division, currently led by executives Baris Cetinok and Dave Richardson, covers areas such as vehicle infotainment, OnStar services, and GM's Super Cruise advanced driver-assist system.The change comes less than six months after leadership shifts in the unit, including the departure of former Apple executive Mike Abbott in March due to health reasons.The job cuts follow GM's efforts to reduce costs amid industry concerns of a potential downturn and significant investments in electric vehicles and software-defined vehicles. GM has recently faced challenges with software issues in its new Chevy Blazer EV, including blank infotainment screens and charging error messages. The company issued a stop sale notice last December due to these problems, which was lifted in March.The layoffs also come after GM cancelled its "Ultra Cruise" programme, a competitor to Tesla's Full Self-Driving system, in January. The company merged the FSD team with its regular Super Cruise team.Despite the layoffs and recent setbacks, the company says it continues to work on expanding its hands-free driving system, with plans to broaden its capabilities by the end of 2025.
Article Summary: GM is laying off more than 1,000 salaried employees globally in its software and services division. The job cuts come as part of a review to streamline operations in the unit. The layoffs represent approximately 1.3% of GM's global workforce of 76,000 as of the end of 2023.

Article Title: British YouTuber Miles Routledge: I might ‘throw’ nuclear bomb on India, just for the sake ...
Article Text:
Miles Routledge’s 'Nuke India' Controversy: Know All About The British You Tuber | Lord Miles

“Hell, I might just launch at India just for the sake of it!”

How the YouTuber reacted to the troll’s comments



“Saar your mum after I do my shift at Uber screams that at night btw saar, please saar, harder saar, I spit on the b***h and all she says is thaank sou saar. I don't shower saar and women don't talk to me saar. I work at Tim Hortons saar.”

“Believe it or not, I just don't like India. Also I can sense an Indian, he is Indian. If a man online suddenly talks about ducking your mother in the first response, he's Indian. Many such cases.”

A UK-based YouTuber named Miles Routledge has faced backlash after he made several racist remarks targeting Indians on the social media platform X (earlier known as Twitter). It all started with a meme video that he uploaded on X as a joke. The video showed alleged nuclear missiles coming out of hidden silos in the US and a worldwide nuclear war.While sharing the video he wrote: “When I become prime minister of England, I'll open the nuclear silos as an explicit warning to any foreign power that interferes with British interests and affairs.I'm not talking huge incidents, I'm itching to launch and atomise entire nations over the smallest infraction.”A few minutes later Routledge added a comment to the post as he said:After sharing the post, he also responded to the comments made from a troll account which is now unavailable.“Saar I will see you soon saar,” Routledge said replying to the troll's commentsIn another reply, Routledge wrote:He also started receiving threatening DMs from the troll. Assuming that the trolling account may belong to an Indian, he started replying to the X profile with racist remarks against Indians. He shared a screenshot of DMs shared between him and the troll.“Indian threatens to find me, it backfires lmao,” he wrote captioning the screenshot. The image also included the YouTuber’s location and description of his clothes as he challenged the troll to come find him. Since then, the post has received more than 5 million views.In separate posts, he also shared his entire conversation as well as the profile details of the trolling account (which later became unavailable) on the platform.Here’s the full conversation between Routledge and the troll:Routledge’s remarks against Indians have drawn criticism. When another X user accused him of rage-baiting, he explained why he thought the troll threatening him was an Indian.He wrote:
Article Summary: UK-based YouTuber named Miles Routledge has faced backlash after he made several racist remarks targeting Indians. It all started with a meme video that he uploaded on X as a joke. The video showed alleged nuclear missiles coming out of hidden silos in the US and a worldwide nuclear war.

Article Title: Apple re-releases iOS 17.6.1 that fixes this important security issue on iPhones
Article Text:
How to install iOS 17.6.1

Apple has released an updated version of iOS 17.6.1 . The update comes almost 10 days after the company first released iOS 17.6.1. The latest release has a build number of 21G101. It brings a fix for an issue that prevented users from enabling or disabling Advanced Data Protection .To install the iOS 17.6.1 update on your iPhone , head to Settings. Here, tap on General and then tap on ‘Software Update’.As per Apple release notes, “This update includes important bug fixes and addresses an issue that prevents enabling or disabling Advanced Data Protection”.Apple explains: “Advanced Data Protection is designed to maintain end-to-end encryption for shared content as long as all participants have Advanced Data Protection enabled. This level of protection is supported in most iCloud sharing features, including iCloud Shared Photo Library, iCloud Drive shared folders and shared Notes.”It must be noted here that the Advanced Data Protection bug impacted a small number of iPhone users . Due to the bug, those enabling the Advanced Data Protection feature were seeing an error message, although it was turned on in the iCloud data.In a separate news, Apple has rolled out the fourth public beta of iOS 18. The release comes as the company nears the launch of 2024 iPhone 16 series and public roll out of iOS 18. The iOS 18 public beta 4 brings a host of new features along with some bug fixes and system stability improvements. These include bringing Bluetooth as individual control in the Control Centre, splash screens in apps like Home, Photos, Notes, and more.
Article Summary: The update comes almost 10 days after the company first released iOS 17.6.1. It brings a fix for an issue that prevented users from enabling or disabling Advanced Data Protection. In a separate news, Apple has rolled out the fourth public beta of iOS 18.

Article Title: Oppo A3 with 50MP camera, 45W fast charging launched, priced at Rs 15,999
Article Text:
Price and availability

Oppo

A3 specifications

Oppo A3 smartphone is here. Oppo has expanded its A-series of smartphones with the launch of the affordable Oppo A3 smartphone in India. The smartphone comes with military grade shock resistance and houses a 120Hz bright display. Oppo A3 comes with 45W fast charging support and runs Android 14 operating system. Oppo A3 comes with a price tag of Rs 15,999 and it can be purchased in Nebula Red and Ocean Blue colour options.The smartphone is available online on the company’s official website .Oppo A3 houses a 6.6-inch HD display with 720x1604 pixel resolution. The display offers 120Hz refresh rate and 89.9% screen-to-body ratio. The smartphone is powered by an octa-core MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset paired with 6GB of RAM.Oppo A3 packs 128GB internal storage which can be expanded further by installing a microSD card. The affordable Oppo smartphone runs Android 14 operating system topped with the company's own layer of ColorOS on top.The dual SIM Oppo smartphone comes with military-grade shock resistance design. The company claims that the Oppo A3 can withstand shock and drop. The smartphone also comes with multiple liquid resistance which means that the smartphone will not get damaged even if it gets in touch with different kinds of liquids.Oppo A3 sports 50MP dual rear camera setup and a 5MP front camera for selfies. The smartphone is backed by a 5,100 mAh battery which comes with 45W fast charging support.
Article Summary: Oppo A3 comes with a price tag of Rs 15,999 and it can be purchased in Nebula Red and Ocean Blue colour options. Oppo A3 houses a 6.6-inch HD display with 720x1604 pixel resolution. The smartphone is powered by an octa-core MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset paired with 6GB of RAM.

Article Title: GoPro lays off 15% of its workforce, affecting 140 employees
Article Text:
Job cuts to be completed by year end

Second layoff in 2024

GoPro lays off 15% of its workforce this year, reported news agency Reuters. The popular action camera maker in a SEC filing said that it plans to cut its workforce as part of a restructuring plan to reduce operating expenses.“Restructuring Plan is anticipated to entail a reduction in force of approximately 15% from our ending second quarter headcount of 925 full-time employees beginning in Q3 2024,” the company said in the filing.The layoffs are expected to begin in the third quarter of 2024 and would be completed by the end of 2024. About 140 employees will be impacted by it.As part of the restructuring plan, the company expects to take charges in the range of $5 million to $7 million, with cash expenses of $1 million to be recognized in the third quarter and about $4 million to $6 million in the fourth quarter of 2024.This is the second time GoPro has announced job cuts in 2024. The company reduced its workforce by 4% in March earlier this year.GoPro had 925 full-time employees at the end of the second quarter ended June 30.Earlier this month, GoPro reported a revenue of $186 million for the second quarter, down 22.7% compared to last year. In May, the U.S. International Trade Commission launched a probe into GoPro's claims that patents for its cameras, systems and accessories were being violated by Chinese firm Arashi Vision.The tech industry continues to see job cuts in 2024. Last week, Cisco announced it would lay off 6,000 employees. In a separate news today, General Motors laid off more than 1,000 salaried employee in its software and services division.
Article Summary: GoPro plans to cut its workforce as part of a restructuring plan to reduce operating expenses. The layoffs are expected to begin in the third quarter of 2024 and would be completed by the end of 2024. About 140 employees will be impacted by it. The company reduced its workforce by 4% in March earlier this year.

Article Title: Google Imagine-3 AI-powered “highest quality text-to-image model” is available in this country
Article Text:
How to access Imagen-3

Google paused image-generation in Gemini chatbot

Google has released Imagen 3 , the latest iteration of its text-to-image AI model, to users in the US. The AI model promises significant improvements over its predecessor and is said to be “highest quality text-to-image model” offered by the tech giant.Imagen 3, accessible through Google's AI Test Kitchen , is designed to generate images with enhanced detail and more realistic lighting.By refining its AI capabilities, Google aims to deliver even more impressive and visually appealing image creations."We introduce Imagen 3, a latent diffusion model that generates high quality images from text prompts. We describe our quality and responsibility evaluations. Imagen 3 is preferred over other state-of-the-art (SOTA) models at the time of evaluation. In addition, we discuss issues around safety and representation, as well as methods we used to minimise the potential harm of our models," the company said in a research paper last week.Imagen 3 will be available in multiple versions, each optimised for different types of tasks, from generating quick sketches to high-resolution images.“Imagen 3 is our highest quality text-to-image model, capable of generating images with even better detail, richer lighting and fewer distracting artefacts than our previous models. We’ve significantly improved Imagen 3’s ability to understand prompts, which helps the models generate a wide range of visual styles and capture small details from longer prompts,” Google said about Imagen-3 when it launched the model at Google I/O this year.If you live in the US, you can access Imagen 3 via ImageFX and Vertex AI. Those living outside the US can register for it using this link . Your email will be added to the waiting list and you will be given access when the AI model is available in your country.Earlier this year, Google Gemini Al chatbot created factually incorrect images. Google acknowledged issues, which led to the temporary suspension of its image generation capabilities. Google CEO Sundar Pichai also said that the company is developing the feature from the ground up and fixing the issues.
Article Summary: Imagen-3 is the latest version of Google's text-to-image AI model. It is available to users in the US and is designed to generate images with enhanced detail and more realistic lighting. It will be available in multiple versions optimised for different types of tasks, from generating quick sketches to high- resolution images.

Article Title: Apple iPhone 16 series to come with major camera upgrades: Here’s what to expect
Article Text:
iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Plus cameras (expected)

iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max cameras (cameras)

Apple is expected to host a launch event in September where it will unveil the iPhone 16 lineup. The series is said to consist of four phones – iPhone 16, iPhone 16 Plus, iPhone 16 Pro, and iPhone 16 Pro Max. The 2024 iPhone series is likely to come with major upgrades in terms o AI, battery and camera. A latest report by AppleInsider hints at the camera features expected on the upcoming iPhone lineup.Take a lookWhile the Apple iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Plus are said to retain the dual-camera setup, they may feature a vertically-aligned module, instead of the current horizontal one. The report says that the smartphones will offer a 48MP primary camera with f/1.6 aperture and 2X telephoto capabilities. There will be a secondary ultra wide-camera with f/2.2 aperture, it adds.As per the report, bigger camera upgrades will come to the Pro models. There will be a triple camera setup on the back – a wide camera, an ultra wide camera, and a telephoto camera. The report states that there will still be a 48MP camera with an f/1.78 aperture that can also take 2X optical-quality.The 3X telephoto lens on iPhone 15 Pro will be replaced by a 5X telephoto lens. The feature will not be confined to the Pro Max model this year. It will be available on both iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max In addition, the ultra-wide lens will finally be bumped to 48MP. It will have .7 micrometer pixels when shooting at full resolution or 1.4 micrometer when used as a quad pixel, the report says.
Article Summary: Apple is expected to host a launch event in September where it will unveil the iPhone 16 lineup. The series is said to consist of four phones – iPhone 16, iPhone 16 Plus, iPhone16 Pro, and iPhone 16 Pro Max. The 2024 iPhone series is likely to come with major upgrades in terms o AI, battery and camera.

Article Title: Court: Burger King has "miserably failed" to prove trademark infringement case against Pune restaurant
Article Text:
Court says no to monetary damages to Pune eatery

In a surprising verdict, a Pune district court has dismissed a 13-year-old lawsuit filed by the American fast-food chain Burger King Corporation against a locally-owned eatery with the same name. The US company had accused the Pune-based Burger King of trademark infringement and sought a permanent injunction, damages, and a halt to the use of the name. The court dismissed the lawsuit filed by the Burger King Corporation in 2011, seeking a permanent injunction restraining infringement of trademark.However, the court ruled in favor of the local eatery, stating that it had been operating under the name "Burger King" since 1991-92, well before the US chain entered the Indian market.The plaintiff's first Indian BURGER KING restaurant was opened in New Delhi on November 9, 2014, the court said.The court found no evidence to support Burger King Corporation's claim that customers were confused or misled by the local eatery's use of the name. Additionally, the company failed to prove any actual financial loss due to the alleged infringement. The court said the Burger King Corporation has "miserably failed" to prove that the eatery here had infringed its trademark Burger King while running the restaurant in Pune.Burger King filed the lawsuit against Anahita Irani and Shapoor Irani. The Iranis opposed the suit, saying it was filed with malafide intentions and to discourage business people who are bonafide users and retailers. They said that apart from the name Burger King, there was absolutely no similarity in the plaintiff's trademark and their own shop name.This decision may have implications for trademark disputes involving established local businesses and multinational corporations.The Pune-based restaurant owners had counterclaimed for damages due to the harassment they endured during the lengthy legal battle. They sought Rs 20 lakh as damages. The court, however, refused any monetary relief to them too, noting that apart from oral evidence, no other proof was submitted to substantiate their claims.
Article Summary: Pune court dismisses 13-year-old lawsuit filed by Burger King Corporation. US company accused Pune-based Burger King of trademark infringement. Court ruled in favor of local eatery, saying it had been operating under the name since 1991-92.

How to use Indian Bike Driving 3D Cheat Codes

Begin by starting the Indian Bike Driving 3D game on your device.

Look for the button featuring a phone icon, typically located at the bottom left corner of the game screen. Click on this icon to open the phone menu.

Within the phone menu, find the handset icon, usually coloured green and positioned in the middle. Click on this icon to proceed.

Upon clicking the handset icon, a contact list will appear on the screen. Look for an icon featuring nine orange circles at the bottom left corner of this screen. Click on it to access the number entry interface.

In the number entry interface, use your device's keypad to input one of the provided cheat codes. Each cheat code corresponds to a specific reward mentioned in the description.

After entering the cheat code, press the confirm or enter button on your device's keypad. This action will immediately grant you the corresponding benefit associated with that cheat code.

Article Title: Vivo V40 with ZEISS co-engineered camera system goes on sale: Price in India, specifications and more
Article Text:
Vivo V40: Price, availability in India

Vivo V40 launch offers

Offline:

6 months of free accidental and liquid damage along with flat 10% instant cashback

12 months zero down payment

Up to 40% off on vivo V-Shield and up to 10% Exchange bonus as part of vivo upgrade programme with SBI, HDFC, Kotak Mahindra, and IDFC First Bank among other partners

Online:

6 months of free accidental and liquid damage along with flat 10% instant cashback

Flat 10% exchange bonus along with up to 6 months no-cost EMI

Vivo V40, V40 Pro: specifications, features

Vivo V40 smartphone is now available for purchase in India. It was launched in the country earlier this month alongside the V40 Pro and comes with ZEISS-style portrait modes as well as the Aura light flash.The V40 is priced at Rs 34,999 for the 8GB + 128GB variant, Rs 36,999 for the 8GB + 256GB variant and Rs 41,999 for the 12GB + 512GB variant. The phone will be available in Ganges Blue, Lotus Purple and Titanium Grey colour variants from Flipkart, Vivo India e-store and all partner retail stores.Launch offers include free accidental and liquid damage protection for six months, cashback options, and various financing schemes, available both online and offline.Vivo V40 sports a 6.78-inch 1.5K AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate and up to 4500 nits peak brightness. The phone is powered by a Snapdragon 7 Gen 3 SoC.The phone comes with ZEISS Co-Engineered Camera System which includes a 50MP main rear camera with OIS and ZEISS optics, complemented by a 50MP ultra-wide camera and a 50MP 2x telephoto portrait camera.The phone also has an IP68 rating for dust and water resistance, packs a 5,500mAh battery with 80W fast charging and runs on Android 14 with Funtouch OS 14. The company has promised three Android updates and four years of security updates for the V40 series.
Article Summary: Vivo V40 is priced at Rs 34,999 for the 8GB + 128GB variant. The phone will be available in Ganges Blue, Lotus Purple and Titanium Grey. Launch offers include free accidental and liquid damage protection for six months, cashback options, and various financing schemes.

Article Title: Cognizant Americas EVP clarifies on Rs 2.5 lakh annual package: Our compensation for engineering graduates is ...
Article Text: IT giant Cognizant has found itself in the crosshairs of social media criticism over its salary packages. The company has clarified that the much-discussed (or rather much-trolled) Rs 2.52 lakh annual salary offer is intended for non-engineering undergraduate degree holders, and not for engineering graduates.Contrary to the uproar on the internet, Cognizant asserts that its starting salary for fresh engineering graduates ranges from Rs 4 lakh to Rs 12 lakh annually, depending on several factors like specialization and certifications.The company has emphasized that its compensation for engineering graduates is competitive with industry standards and even surpasses those of some peers."Our recent job posting for talent from non-engineering backgrounds, with a 3-year undergraduate degree has been grossly misrepresented. This job posting, with compensation of Rs 2.52 lakhs annually, was only for candidates with a 3-year undergraduate degree and not for engineering graduates."Our annual compensation for fresh engineering graduates ranges from Rs 4 lakhs to Rs 12 lakhs annually, depending on the category of hiring, skill set, and advanced industry accredited certifications," said Surya Gummadi, EVP and President, Cognizant Americas ."The compensation we offer for engineering graduates is highly competitive within the IT services peer group," he said. He said Cognizant has been recruiting and upskilling freshers from engineering institutions as well as colleges offering degrees in science, arts, and commerce."We have been recruiting and upskilling freshers from engineering institutions as well as colleges offering degrees in science, arts, and commerce. Today, as AI increasingly powers modern businesses, we are creating new pathways for talent to thrive in India's technology industry," Gummadi further said.Talking of Cognizant's India operation, Gummadi said, "India is the heart of Cognizant and its largest talent hub - with over 70 per cent of its over 3,36,000 global workforce - based in major metros and Tier-2 cities, across the country."
Article Summary: IT giant Cognizant has found itself in the crosshairs of social media criticism over its salary packages. The company has clarified that the much-discussed (or rather much-trolled) Rs 2.52 lakh annual salary offer is intended for non- engineering undergraduate degree holders.
